title: iMessage History: Sibling Favoritism
description: Text message history showing pattern of parental favoritism leading up to the car purchase incident

message_history.message: Hey Mom, can we talk about something? I'm dealing with some medical bills from my surgery and was wondering if you might be able to help out a little?
Honey, things are really tight right now. We're helping Jake get back on his feet. You're doing so well at your job, I'm sure you can handle it!
I know, but it's $8,000. I've been really responsible with money but this is a lot.
I know sweetie but Jake really needs us right now. You're so strong and capable. We believe in you!
Thanks Mom and Dad for helping with rent again üôè You guys are the best
Of course honey! That's what family is for ‚ù§Ô∏è
Lost my job again. Boss was an a**hole. Can I stay with you guys for a bit?
Of course son. Door is always open.
Hey Dad, I hate to ask but I'm really struggling with these medical bills. Any chance you could help out even a little? Like $1000?
Your mother and I discussed it. We think you're capable of handling this on your own. You've always been the responsible one.
But you just paid Jake's rent for the 3rd time this year...
That's different. He's going through a tough time.
And I'm not? I had surgery Dad.
We need to go. Talk later.
OMG!!! Mom and Dad got me a car!! üöóüöó A 2022 Honda!! I can't believe it!!
We wanted to help you get to job interviews! We love you! üíï
Proud of you son. This will help you turn things around.
You bought him a CAR?!
He needed it to get to work.
He doesn't HAVE work. And you said you couldn't help me with my medical debt THREE DAYS AGO.
That's not fair. We do what we can for both of you. Your situation is different.
How is it different? You have money for a CAR but not $1000 for my surgery bills?
Why are you trying to make this about you? Your brother needs help right now.
I needed help too. I ASKED for help. You said no.
You're being ungrateful. After everything we've done for you.
Dad, can we please talk about this? This doesn't feel fair.
Your father doesn't want to talk right now. You've upset him.
I need to call you. Can we talk tonight?
Fine. But I hope you'll be more reasonable.

context_notes.pattern_established: Multiple instances of financial support for Jake, repeated refusals for protagonist
context_notes.emotional_buildup: Protagonist tried asking nicely multiple times before confrontation
context_notes.triggering_incident: Car purchase announcement in family group chat while protagonist was denied help
context_notes.current_state: Protagonist is preparing to have difficult conversation with Mom

roleplay_entry_point: The conversation will begin with the scheduled phone call where protagonist needs to address the favoritism pattern.
